abstracts.cdata!:
The China Higher Education Reform
            Project had a satisfactory outcome, is highly likely to be
            sustainable, and has a substantial institutional development
            impact. Both performances of the Bank and the Borrower were
            satisfactory. The key lessons concerned the need for
            government commitment to large-scale reform of higher
            education; effectively coordinating and integrating
            technical assistance and management when training key
            management and teaching staff; clarifying capacity building
            needs at the national and institutional levels; transforming
            the evaluation system into an internally motivated,
            self-generating agency; establishing guidelines for
            accreditation of higher education institutions; reinforcing
            institutional autonomy with a supportive policy framework
            and financial arrangements, and strong governance;
            competitive bidding in textbook acquisition; balancing cost
            considerations with quality and specifications of service
            standard when procuring precision instruments; and financing
            equipment maintenance with counterpart funding.
